RT0133-d-06-19-01-RT.Narrative: CREW 221 WAS SHOVING THIRTY-ONE LOADED SLAB CARS SOUTH ON SENECA TRACK 12.  THEY WERE INSTRUCTED TOSHOVE THE CARS OVER THE SCALE TRACK, THOUGH NOT FOR WEIGHTING PURPOSES.  THE FIRST TWENTY-THREE CARSPASSED OVER THE SENECA #12/SCALE LEAD SWITCH WITHOUT INCIDENT.  HOWEVER, THE REMAINING EIGHT CARS COUPLED TO THE LOCOMOTIVES, DERAILED AT THE SWITCH WHICH IS LOCATED ON A SLIGHT CURVE IN THE TRACK.THE CREW WAS UNAWARE THAT THE EIGHTH CAR FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE DERAILED AS WELL AS THE CARS FOLLOWINGIT, UNTIL THEY MOVED  AROUND THE CURVE AND IT WAS REALIZED THAT THE FOURTH CAR FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE HAD DERAILED.  THE CREW CONSISTED OF AN ENGINEER, CONDUCTOR, AND ONE BRAKEMAN.  THE ENGINEER WAS OPERATING  THE LOCOMOTIVE UNIT, THE BRAKEMAN WAS ON THE LEAD END, AND THE CONDUCTOR WAS IN THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE UNIT. WHEN HE REALIZED  THE FOURTH CAR HAD DERAILED, HE INFORMED THE ENGINEER TO STOP.  THE EIGHTH CAR THAT INITIALLY DERAILED , WAS LOADED WITH THREE SLABS TOWARD THE SOUTH END OF THE CAR, ONEOF WHICH WAS LONGER THAN THE OTHER TWO.  DUE TO THE UNEVEN LOADING, THIS CAUSED THE CAR TO RIDE UPAND OVER THE SWITCHPOINT, CAUSING TEN LENGTHS OF RAIL TO TURN AND THE CARS TO DERAIL.  THIS WAS WHYIT WAS NOT IMMEDIATELY APPARENT THAT THE DERAILMENT HAD OCCURRED.  DUE TO THE FACT THAT THEY WERE OPERATING ON THE SCALE LEAD TRACK, THIS DERAILMENT ALSO CAUSED SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO THE SCALE (APPROXIMATELY $25,000) WHICH IS INCLUDED IN THE TRACK DAMAGE AMOUNT.

166202-d-06-03-01-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 428 WAS HELD AT THE CUT-OFF FOR APPROXIMATELY 15 MINUTES. THEY WERE INSTRUCTED TO COME INTO THE YARD "WESTBOUND TO WESTBOUND" AS THE TRAIN ENTERED THE YARD THE CREW NOTICED THAT CROSSOVER SWITCHAND WESTBOUND SWITCH NEEDED TO BE LINED FOR THEIR ROUTE.  THE CONDUCTOR GOT OFF THE LOCOMOTIVE ANDPROCEEDED TO WALK AHEAD OF THE MOVEMENT LINING THE SWITCHES  AS THE TRAIN MOVED SLOWLY BEHIND HIM.THE CONDUCTOR BOARDED THE LOCOMOTIVE AND THEY PROCEEDED INTO THE WESTBOUND TRACK WHEN THE 14, 15, &16TH CARS DERAILED NEAR THE SWITCHES THAT WERE LINED DUE TO EXCESSIVE DYNAMIC BRAKING.      ROOT CAUSE & RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION(S): TOO MUCH RETARDING DUE TO HEAVY DYNAMIC BRAKE USAGE FROM LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER.  FINDINGS, RESULTS OF INVESTIGATION: ROAD FOREMAN RODE WITH SAME ENGINEER ON JUNE 15, 2001 FROM BENSENVILLE TO MILWAUKEE. DID REVIEW WITH ENGINEER ON TRAIN HANDLING WHEN USING DYNAMICBRAKE ALSO REVIEW RULES PERTAINING TO DYNAMIC BRAKE USAGE.  MANAGER OF OPERATING PRACTICES UPDATEDDYNAMIC BRAKE RULE THROUGH GENERAL ORDER A-32 REVIEW THIS WITH ENGINEER AS WELL.  RULES VIOLATED: SECTION 6 RULE 7.13 OF AIR BRAKE AND TRAIN HANDLING RULES.NoneNoneNone

166468-d-06-17-01-SOO.Narrative: 3 P.M. SWITCH JOB WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SHOVING 44 CARS FROM CARGILL ELEVATOR INTO RICES POINT YARDTRACK NO. 14.  CONDUCTOR WAS STANDING AT THE CLEARANCE POINT OF TRACK 14 AND THE BRAKEMAN WAS ON THEWEST END OF THE TRACK, PROTECTING THE SHOVE. THE BRAKEMAN AT THE WEST END OF THE YARD INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER THAT HE HAD 12 CARS TO GO.  ENGINEER TOOK FIRST SERVICE AND WAS IN THE PROCESS OF RELEASING THE AIR WHEN HE WAS TOLD TO DUMP THE AIR BY THE BRAKEMAN, WHO NOTED THAT THE THE HIND FOUR CARS HAD SHIFTED OVER.  EMERGENCY APPLICATION WAS APPLIED AND MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED WITHIN THREE CAR LENGTHS.  UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT FOUR LOADS OF WHEAT HAD DERAILED ON TRACK 14 AND ONE CAR ON THE ADJACENT TRACK #13, UP 87424 HAD BEEN STRUCK BY  CAR UP 21537 ON TRACK 14 WHICH WAS LEANING AT A 45 DEGREE ANGLE.  FINAL CAUSE:  ROADBED SETTLED COMBINED WITH POOR TIE CONDITION.  ROOT CAUSE OF INCIDENT:  EXTREMELY WET WEATHER ALONG WITH HAVING BEEN NO SURFACING OR TIES INSTALLED IN RICES POINT YARD TRACKS 12 THROUGH 15 FOR MANY YEARS.NoneNoneNoneNone

166485-d-06-19-01-SOO.Narrative: DMVW ADVISED CP PORTAL DISPATCHER THAT THEY DERAILED FIVE LOADS OF GRAIN WHILE OPERATING OVER CP TRACKAGE IN FLAXTON, ND YARD. THE CONDUCTOR WAS STANDING ON CROSSING, WATCHING FOR THE END OF THE TRAIN SO HE COULD STOP IT AT THAT LOCATION.THE ENGINEER WAS PULLING ON THEM IN #3 THROTTLE AND WAS GOING ABOUT 10 MPH.  THEY HAD PULLED AHEADABOUT 21 CARS WHEN THE CONDUCTOR SAW DUST AND TOLD THE ENGINEER TO STOP.  IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT 47TH THRU 51ST CARS HAD DERAILED.NoneNoneNoneNone

I0501-d-06-27-01-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Other mechanical and electrical failures, (CAR) (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0501-d-06-27-01-PATH.Accident Cause: Other mechanical and electrical failures, (CAR) (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0501-d-06-27-01-PATH.Narrative: ON WEDNESDAY, JUNE 27, 2001 AT APPROXIMATELY 11:40 AM, AN ENGINEER WAS MOVING A TRAIN FROM TRACK #3JOURNAL SQUARE ONTO TRACK #7 IN A YARD TO THE BUMPING BLOCK.  CARS IN CONSIST WERE 769-181-101-657-691-163-833.  ENGINEER STATES HE PLACED THE CONTROLLER TO THE OFF POSITION AND COASTED DOWN TRACK #7.APPROXIMATELY 20 FEET FROM THE BLOCK, THE EQUIPMENT TOOK EXCESSIVE POWER WITH THE CONTROLLER IN THE OFF POSITION.  HE APPLIED THE BRAKES AND RELEASED THE CONTROLLER.  THE EQUIPMENT STRUCK THE BUMPING BLOCK.  INVESTIGATION OF THE INCIDENT SHOWS THAT A STANDING BRAKE TEST AT THE SCENE FOUND NO DEFECTS.  ALL AIR GAUGE READINGS WERE NORMAL.  THE CONSIST WAS POWER TESTED FROM CAR 769.  WHEN THE MASTER CONTROLLER WAS PLACED IN THE OFF POSITION, POWER DID DROP OUT.  THERE WERE 5 CARS DAMAGED AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT.  THE BUMPING BLOCK ON TRACK #7 WAS ALSO DAMAGED AND WAS REPLACED.  TOTAL COSTWAS $18,150.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

EQ20010602-d-06-05-01-LI.Accident Cause: Switch damaged or out of adjustment
EQ20010602-d-06-05-01-LI.Narrative: ON TUESDAY, 6/5/01, AT 11:45AM, THE WORK EXTRA 152 WAS OPERATING WITH THREE LOCOMOTIVES IN CONSIST MOVING WESTWARD ON THE ATLANTIC PIPE TRACK TO THE NORTH SIDING TRACK AT HICKSVILLE.  AS THE LEAD AXLEOF THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE (ENGINE NO. 152) TRAVERSED THE FACING POINT SWITCH FOR THE RUNAROUND TRACK,THE R1 WHEEL OF THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE PICKED THE POINT OF THE SWITCH RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF THE NUMBER ONE AXLE OF THE ENGINE 152.  THE CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO BE THAT THE SWITCH INVOLVED WAS OUT OF ADJUSTMENT OR DAMAGED (FRA CAUSE CODE T-311).NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

EQ20010606-d-06-12-01-LI.Primary Accident Cause: Switch point gapped (between switch point and stock rail)
EQ20010606-d-06-12-01-LI.Accident Cause: Switch point gapped (between switch point and stock rail)
EQ20010606-d-06-12-01-LI.Narrative: THE WORK TRAIN NO. 3 (32 CAR STONE TRAIN WITH 3 LOCOMOTIVES ON EAST END) WHILE PROCEEDING EASTWARD ON NUMBER 4 TRACK AT FRESH POND, THE FIFTEENTH CAR OF THE CONSIST (STONE CAR LI 6123) DERAILED AT A FACING POINT CROSSOVER AUTOMATIC SAFETY SWITCH.  THE TRAIN CREW REVERSED THE MOVEMENT WESTWARD FOLLOWING THE INITIAL DERAILMENT OF CAR NUMBER LI6123 WHICH RESULTED IN THE DERAILMENT OF AN ADDITIONAL FIVE CARS AS THE TRAIN CONTINUED TO PROCEED WEST.  THE INITIAL CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINEDTO BE FRA CUASE CODE T319- SWITCH POINT GAPPED, SMALL OPENING BETWEEN THE SWITCH POINT AND THE STOCK RAIL WHICH CAUSED THE WHEEL (LEAD AXLE) OF CAR LI6123 TO PICK THE SWITCH POINT AND DERAIL.  AS THETRAIN WAS MOVED IN A REVERSE DIRECTIOM, FIVE ADDITIONAL CARS DERAILED FOLLOWING THE INITIAL SINGLECAR DERAILMENT RESULTING IN MAJOR EQUIPMENT AND TRACK DAMAGE.  NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED AS A RESULTOF THIS ACCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
